member.summary: This method should be invoked when the vendor ID changes. This method will validate the vendor and pull in the new default vendor information. 1. Validate Vendor ID / Vendor Num 2. check for inactive vendor 3. check Vendor for Approved flag 4. check item(s) for conficts with AprvVend
member.param: Proposed vendor ID to be validated

member.name: M:Epicor.Mfg.IF.IPO.CheckPONum(System.Int32,System.Boolean@,System.String@)
member.summary: Method to call when entering proposed PO Number. This method will return two output variables. One is a logical field to indicate if the PO number entered is existing or not. The other variable is for the error message in case the proposed PO number is invalid. Removed Return from the end of this procedure
member.param: Indicates if the proposed PO number is already existing.
Error message for the user to see.

member.name: M:Epicor.Mfg.IF.IPO.PartStatusValidationMessages(System.String@,System.String@,System.Boolean@,System.String@)
member.summary: The method is to be run on leave of the PartNum, Revision fields before the GetPartInfo or Update methods are run. This returns all the questions that need to be asked before a part can be changed.
member.param: The new PartNum if a substitute part is found, partNum will be the substitute part
Asks if the user wants to use a substitute part
Indicates other substitute parts besides the default exist

Type of message returned. if avail porel then message porel.poline porel.trantype. Values can be; "Question" (asking if they want to use the substitute part) "Warning" (Warns them that a part is onhold or runout). "Error" (Part in Inactive, or Onhold/Runout parts are not accepted in this case) . "Question" is asking if they want to use the substitute part.
